subject: Re: Using SCIM to type Quikscript
msgSnippet: Tim, I ve uploaded the SCIM stuff to the Files area as scim-qs.tar.gz. Let me know if it works - or not. And Benct - why not KMFL?  Simple.  When I went
messageBody:
Tim, I've uploaded the SCIM stuff to the Files area as scim-qs.tar.gz.
Let me know if it works - or not.

And Benct - why not KMFL? Simple. When I went looking for a Linux
keyboard mapping tool I found SCIM first!


Anthony H


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Benct Philip Jonsson <bpj@...>
wrote:
>
> On 2008-05-27 Anthony Hagan wrote:
> > Since the keyboard layout poll, I've set up some SCIM tables so that
> > one can type using Peter Guiness' layout, and get QS text in either
> > the Unicode Private Use Area (as used by Paul Tremblay's ThothUni
> > font) or in the Jerome or King Plus fonts. If anyone is at all
> > interested, I'll put the tables up in the files area.
>
> What about KMFL? It's a *lot* easier to write layouts for
> than directly for SCIM!
>
> /BP -- Ubuntu newbie!
>
> /BP 8^)>
> --
> Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> "C'est en vain que nos Josués littéraires crient
> à la langue de s'arrêter; les langues ni le soleil
> ne s'arrêtent plus. Le jour où elles se *fixent*,
> c'est qu'elles meurent." (Victor Hugo)
>
